tweets.text: @vgr Raising kids are the most difficult work to do for me, it is more about ‘raising’ myself
@vgr I did not know that I have to change myself in order to raise them
@vgr I was being taught more by my kids than I teach my kids, so this expression of being a good parent is to teach your kid is the wrong expression,
@vgr Raising kid is more about facing your insecurities, battling your bad habit and prioritizing what is most important in life
@vgr Raising kid is the best way to change yourself to become a better person, to ignore the superfluous stuff the world has to offer ...
@vgr It question all my assumptions of what is right and wrong, and just be fuck with all of it. It makes my superiority vanishes over time.
@vgr You know what they say: children would have a better chance to enter the kingdom of heaven than ...., begin with the beginner’s mind
@vgr Being with kids and staying home with them, forces me that specialization is ‘bad’, life is so much more interesting than that. It forces me to face my insecurities head on.
@vgr Raising kids could be translate ‘building’ to change the world, which makes me feel better about my role and not to just super focused on SV mantra that ‘only’ software is changing the world.

@vgr Being with kids open my heart to different things in life, to see that the most important thing in life is not knowledge - ability to be fully human, that we all have it when we are born but somehow we become fossilized and to rigid over time. we die as a rigid, fossilized person

@vgr is the opposite of SV mantra 'doing things scaleable', changing heart 1 person at a time and it takes years to 'build' that person. The most unscalable thing you could build. One at a time. Everyone is unique, different respond, different interaction.

@vgr raising kids =/ having kids, many people especially man just having kids but they are NOT actively raising them. This is probably more true as asian, because of our past culture. He = work, She = stay home + raise kids. Me/asian/he = stay home + raise kids + no work.
